Generation I.Red: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp .
Generation I.Green: (This entry was originally untranslated in English until it was reused in Pokémon FireRed .)
Generation I.Blue: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp .
Generation I.Yellow: This Pok é mon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
Generation I.Stadium: Capable of flying incredibly quickly. In full flight, by the time its flapping is heard, it is long gone.

Generation II.Gold: Its well-developed chest muscles make it strong enough to whip up a gusty windstorm with just a few flaps.
Generation II.Silver: It spreads its beautiful wings wide to frighten its enemies. It can fly at Mach 2 speed.
Generation II.Crystal: Its outstanding vision allows it to spot splashing Magikarp , even while flying at 3300 feet .
Generation II.Stadium 2: Its well-developed chest muscles make it strong enough to whip up a gusty windstorm with just a few flaps. (Pokémon Red, Silver, or Crystal inserted) It spreads its beautiful wings wide to frighten its enemies. It can fly at Mach 2 speed. (Pokémon Blue, Gold, or Yellow inserted)

Generation III.Ruby: This Pok é mon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pok é mon .
Generation III.Sapphire: This Pok é mon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pok é mon .
Generation III.Emerald: This Pok é mon has gorgeous, glossy feathers. Many Trainers are so captivated by the beautiful feathers on its head that they choose Pidgeot as their Pok é mon .
Generation III.FireRed: It spreads its gorgeous wings widely to intimidate enemies. It races through the skies at Mach-2 speed.
Generation III.LeafGreen: When hunting, it skims the surface of water at high speed to pick off unwary prey such as Magikarp .
